isis.stitle: RECONDITIONING BRAKE DRUMS AND SHOES - BRAKE SHOES

svcproc.title: INSPECTION
svcproc.para: When brake linings or blocks are worn to within 1/4 inch (6.3 mm) of rivets, the brake shoes must be removed and replaced or relined. It is recommended that all the brakes be replaced or relined at the same time since this will maintain balanced braking on the vehicle. If complete replacement is not desirable or necessary, be sure that all lining on one axle (both sides) is replaced or relined at the same time.

caution.para: Do not let brake lining wear to the point that the rivets or bolts touch the drum or drum damage will occur.

step1.para: Check shoes for bent or cracked webs, or table, broken welds, loose rivets or elongated rivet holes ( Figure 21). Discard shoes that exhibit any of the above defects.
Check anchor pin and cam roller contact areas in shoe web for elongation or wear ( Figure 21). Replace shoe if diameter exceeds the brake manufacturer's specifications.
